fields.physical_description: 1 of 246 portrait studies of members of the royal family of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies, diplomats and others; copies of paintings, and details of the insignia of orders of Chivalry, made as preliminary drawings for miniature paintings.  Mounted in a volume containing 44 pages, interleaved with tissue paper.  With an index to the sitters.  Signed in pencil 'G. Sacco', dated and numbered.
fields.materials_techniques: Pencil, pen and ink, body colour and watercolour
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C, case 91, shelf B, box 19
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level C

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings Accessions 1955-1956 London: HMSO, 1963 The full text of the entry is as follows: "SACCO, G. (1805-1889) Portrait studies of members of the royal family of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies, diplomats and others; copies of paintings, and details of the insignia of orders of Chivalry, made as preliminary drawings (246) for miniature paintings. Mounted in a volume containing 44 pages, interleaved with tissue paper. With an index to the sitters. Most signed in pencil G. Sacco, dated and numbered. Pencil, pen and ink, body- and water-colour. Various sizes E.92-337-1956 Among the drawings which can be identified are: Sons of Francis I of Bourbon-Sicily, King of the Two Sicilies Leopold, Count of Syracuse (1813-1860). Dated between 1829 and 1831. E.94, 95, 98, 101, 109-1956 Antonio, Count of Lecce (1816-1843). Dated between 1829 and 1831. E.96, 99, 111-1956 Ferdinand II, King of the Two Sicilies (1810-1859), when Duke of Calabria. Dated 1829. E.97-1956 Ferdinand II, King of the Two Sicilies (1810-1959). Dated 1831, 1832. E.103, 110-1956 Charles, Prince of Capua (1811-1862). Dated 1831, 1835. E.100, 115-1956 Louis, Count of Aquila (1824-1897). Dated 1831. E.102-1956 Francis de Paul, Count of Trapani (1827-1892). Dated 1831. E.104-1956 Daughters of Francis I, King of the Two Sicilies Maria Amalia (1818-1857), later wife of Sebastian of Spain. Dated 1831. E.105-1956 Maria Antoinetta (1814-1898), later wife of Leopold II, Grand Duke of Tuscany. Dated 1831. E.106-1956 Theresa (1822-1889), later wife of Pedro II d'Alcantara, Emperor of Brasil. Dated 1831. E.107-1956 Maria Carolina (1820-1861), later wife of Charles of Spain, Count of Montemolin. Dated 1831. E.108-1956 Other portraits and drawings Alexandra Feodorowna (1798-1860), Consort of Nicholas I, Emperor of Russia. Dated 1846. E.112-1956 Marie Amelia of Bourbon-Sicily (1782-1866), Queen Consort of Louis Philippe, King of the French. E.113-1956 Maria Christina of Savoy (1812-1836), Queen Consort of Ferdinand II, King of the Two Sicilies. Dated 1836. E.118-1956 Grand Duchess Olga of Russia (1822-1897), later Queen Consort of Charles I, King of Württemberg. Dated 1846. E.120-1956 Prince Albert, Consort of Queen Victoria. Dated 1850. After Winterhalter. E.124-1956 Queen Victoria. Dated 4 juin 1850. After Winterhalter. E.125-1956 Self-portrait. Dated 1832. E.128-1956 Antonio, Prince of Carini, Neapolitan Ambassador to Spain. Dated 1853. E.136-1956 Constantine Musurus Pashe (1807-1891), Turkish Ambassador in London E.137, 327-1956 Warren Grigsby, United States consul. Dated 1844. E.138-1956 Pope Pius IX (Giovanni Maria Mastai-Ferretti) (1792-1878). E.234-1956 Princess of Carini. Dated 1853. E.278-1956 Anne (d.1867), daughter of Stefanaki Beg Vagorides, Prince of Samos, wife of Constantine Musurus Pashe. Dated 1853. E.282-1956 Enamelled badge of the Order of the Golden Fleece. E.312-1956 Jewelled badge of the Order of the Golden Fleece. E.313-1956 Star of the Order of St. Ferdinand, and of Merit, of the Two Sicilies. E.314-1956 Star of the Order of St. Januarius, of the Two Sicilies. E.315-1956 Beatrice Cenci, after Guido Reni. E.317-1956 Ferdinand I, King of the Two Sicilies (1751-1825). E.319-1956 The Bridgewater Madonna, after Raphael. E.333-1956 Louis Philippe, King of the French (1773-1850). Dated 1833. E.334-1956"
